place_of_publication.publication_title: in W. H. Harvey et al., Fl. Cap.

treatment.description: Stems prostrate, gray-white, 20–60 cm; younger stems densely clothed with white, loosely appressed scales, 1.5 mm. Leaves crowded; blade gray-white, folded inward, midvein not conspicuous ab-axially, obovate, 1.5–2.2 × 0.7–0.9 cm, apex obtuse and recurved, thick, papillate. Flowers concealed by leaves, usually on short lateral branches; calyx lobes white to yellow adaxially, oblong or lanceolate-oblong, 3 mm, ciliate near apex, hairy abaxially; filaments shorter than calyx lobes; anthers yellow; styles 4(–5). Capsules concealed among leaf bases, persistent. Seeds 4(–5).
